docs.title: Project Documents
docs.text:
• Add your architecture diagram here
  • Update the SECURITY document
  • Update the TECHNICAL DEBT document

docs.title: Recommended Tasks for Library Pipeline Project
Data Ingestion
docs.text:
• Build CSV ingestion function (load_csv())
  • Build JSON ingestion function (load_json())
  • Build Excel ingestion function (load_excel())
  • Build text file reader (load_text())
  • Test ingestion locally in Jupyter

docs.title: Data Cleaning
docs.text:
• Implement duplicate removal function
  • Implement missing value handler
  • Implement date standardization
  • Implement ISBN validation
  • Test cleaning functions

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
• Write tests for ingestion module (70%+ coverage)
  • Write tests for cleaning module (70%+ coverage)
  • Write tests for validation module (70%+ coverage)
  • Ensure all tests pass

docs.title: CI/CD
docs.text:
• Review GitHub Actions workflow
  • Test workflow on feature branch
  • Fix any failing CI/CD checks
  • Implement pull request workflow

docs.title: Deployment
docs.text:
• Prepare data for Fabric upload
  • Create Fabric notebook
  • Deploy package to Fabric
  • Test in Fabric environment

docs.title: Documentation & Presentation
docs.text:
• Complete README
  • Document architecture decisions
  • Create presentation slides
  • Prepare demo environment
  • Practice presentation

docs.title: Sensitive Data
docs.text:
• What data is sensitive?
  • How did you protect it?

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
• Who can access what?
  • How did you implement this?

docs.title: Compliance
docs.text:
• What regulations apply (GDPR, Data Protection Act)?
  • How do you comply?

docs.title: Limitations
docs.text:
• What security measures didn't you implement?
  • What would you do in production?

docs.title: Workspace Level
docs.text:
• Workspace admins: [List admins]
  • Members: [List members]
  • Viewers: [List viewers]

docs.title: Data Level
docs.text:
• Row-level security implemented on circulation data
  • Branch managers can only see their branch data
  • System administrators can see all data

docs.title: Personal Identifiable Information (PII)
docs.text:
• Member IDs are pseudonymized
  • No names or contact details stored in pipeline
  • Access logged and auditable

docs.title: Data Classification
docs.text:
• Confidential: Member checkout history
  • Internal: Branch statistics
  • Public: Aggregated counts (no PII)

docs.title: Compliance
docs.text:
• GDPR compliant: Right to erasure implemented
  • Data Protection Act 2018 compliant
  • Retention policy: 7 years for audit trail

docs.title: Audit Trail
docs.text:
• All data access logged in Fabric
  • Regular security reviews conducted
  • Incident response plan documented

docs.title: Future Enhancements
docs.text:
• Implement column-level encryption
  • Add data masking for non-production environments
  • Implement multi-factor authentication
  • Regular penetration testing

docs.title: Sample: Technical Debt
docs.text: Document shortcuts taken during development and improvements needed for production readiness.

docs.title: What is Technical Debt?
docs.text:
Technical debt refers to: - Quick solutions that need refining - Features not yet implemented - Known limitations - Future improvements

This is NOT failure - it's honest reflection on what you'd improve with more time.

docs.title: High Priority
docs.text:
Items that would cause problems in production

  1. [Issue Name]
  2. Location: filename.py line X or module/function
  3. Problem: What's wrong or incomplete?
  4. Impact: Why does this matter?
  5. Solution: How would you fix it?
  6. Effort: Estimated time to fix

Example: 1. Hard-coded file paths - Location: ingestion.py lines 23, 45, 67 - Problem: Paths like /data/file.csv won't work on other systems - Impact: Pipeline fails when deployed to different environments - Solution: Use environment variables or config file - Effort: 2 hours

docs.title: Medium Priority
docs.text:
Items that should be addressed but aren't urgent

  1. [Issue Name]
  2. Location:
  3. Problem:
  4. Solution:
  5. Effort:

Example: 1. Incomplete test coverage - Location: test_ingestion.py - Problem: Excel loading function only has 65% coverage - Impact: Edge cases might not be caught - Solution: Add tests for malformed Excel files, empty sheets - Effort: 1-2 hours

docs.title: Low Priority
docs.text:
Nice-to-have improvements

  1. [Issue Name]
  2. Location:
  3. Problem:
  4. Solution:
  5. Effort:

Example: 1. Long functions - Location: cleaning.py - standardize_dates() is 50 lines - Problem: Hard to test individual parts, difficult to maintain - Solution: Break into smaller functions - Effort: 1 hour

  • TODO: Example: "No streaming support - batch processing only"
  • TODO: Example: "No retry logic for failed transformations"
  • TODO: Example: "No data versioning or rollback capability"

docs.title: Code Quality Issues
docs.text:
Areas where code quality could be improved:

  • TODO: List code smells or anti-patterns
  • Example: "Repeated code in ingestion functions - could create base class"
  • Example: "Magic numbers in validation rules - should be constants"
  • Example: "Inconsistent error handling - some functions raise, some return None"

docs.title: Performance Concerns
docs.text:
Areas where performance could be improved:

  • TODO: Identify bottlenecks
  • Example: "Loading entire CSV into memory - doesn't scale to large files"
  • Example: "No parallel processing - pipeline is sequential"
  • Example: "Date parsing is slow - could cache format detection"

docs.title: Security & Compliance Gaps
docs.text:
Security measures not yet implemented:

  • TODO: List security improvements needed
  • Example: "No encryption for data at rest"
  • Example: "Secrets stored in code (should use Key Vault)"
  • Example: "No audit logging for data access"
  • Example: "RLS not implemented (see SECURITY.md)"

docs.title: Dependencies & Maintenance
docs.text:
Dependency-related concerns:

  • TODO: List dependency issues
  • Example: "Using older version of Pandas (1.5.0) - should upgrade to 2.x"
  • Example: "No automated dependency scanning"
  • Example: "Some libraries have known vulnerabilities (check pip audit)"

docs.title: Documentation Gaps
docs.text:
Documentation that needs improvement:

  • TODO: List missing or incomplete docs
  • Example: "No API reference documentation"
  • Example: "Setup instructions incomplete for Windows users"
  • Example: "No troubleshooting guide"
  • Example: "Function docstrings missing examples"

docs.title: Lessons Learned
docs.text:
What would you do differently next time?

  1. TODO: Reflect on the process
  2. Example: "Start with tests earlier (test-driven development)"
  3. Example: "Spend more time on architecture planning"
  4. Example: "Use a linter from day 1 (would have caught many issues)"
  5. Example: "Set up CI/CD on day 1 (not day 3)"

docs.title: Estimated Total Effort to Address
docs.text: Priority Items Estimated Effort High TODO TODO hours Medium TODO TODO hours Low TODO TODO hours Total TODO TODO hours

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
Remember: - Technical debt is normal and expected - Documenting it shows maturity and professionalism - The goal isn't zero debt - it's managed, intentional debt - Every project has trade-offs between speed and perfection

When to address: - High priority: Before production deployment - Medium priority: In next sprint/iteration - Low priority: When time permits or if causing pain
